page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: From the 32 responses to our questionnaire,78% of the houses in which those asked, lived, have been built in the last 20 years. Typically, most are semi-detatched and are found on housing estates. When buillt they were less than half the price of similar accommodation in urban areas, hence their attraction to those able to either work in the local seevice industries or to commute to other areas daily. This pattern, however, is not true of the whole of the D-Block, only in and around the village of Stalham itself. Here, in an accurate count based on both electoral rolls and personal observation, 656 (67.9%) of the 819 houses in the village have been built in the last fifteen years:- Rivermead, Heron Gardens, Millside, Lyndford Estate and the new council houses
